Вы обходите войска перед боем. Произнося речь, вы смотрите им в глаза, пытаясь передать всю важность момента:^^'Со всего света мы шли навстречу судьбе, и встретим ее сегодня на поле боя! И после нашей смерти люди будут петь об этом великом сражении, которое принесло нам славу!'

Вы обходите войска перед боем. Произнося речь, вы смотрите им в глаза, пытаясь передать всю важность момента:^^'Братья! Когда-то вы были детьми, но превратились в зрелых мужей. Вчера мы двигались вперед. Сегодня мы будем сражаться! Сегодня мы прольем кровь врагов и разорим его земли. Сегодня мы расколем его щиты. Всю нашу жизнь мы мечтали об этом. Сегодня мы победим или погибнем как братья. Сегодня мы будем пировать в домах наших врагов!'

Вы обходите войска перед боем. Произнося речь, вы смотрите им в глаза, пытаясь передать всю важность момента:^^'Солдаты! Братья мои! Мы прошли много лиг, но ваша награда ждет вас. Враги будут петь вам славу в предсмертном стоне! Вперед! Навстречу судьбе! Сражайтесь! Сражайтесь храбро!'

Вы обходите войска перед боем. Произнося речь, вы смотрите им в глаза, пытаясь передать всю важность момента:^^'Друзья мои! Услышьте! Сегодня песня в наших сердцах будет записана кровью врагов! Вы вольные люди, и никто не может безнаказанно вторгаться в ваши земли. Против нас целая орда, но они хотят сжечь ваши дома, а не защитить свои, и потому они будут разбиты! Наточите мечи! Бейте их и не думайте отступать! Мужчина не уступит свою землю и свою славу трусливым налетчикам! Сражайтесь! Лучше умереть, но отступить -- никогда! Никогда!'

Вы обходите войска перед боем. Произнося речь, вы смотрите им в глаза, пытаясь передать всю важность момента:^^'Мы стоим перед врагом, готовые к битве. Выньте мечи! Поднимите копья! За этой стеной щитов -- наши дома. Так поприветствуем врага! Позволим ему прийти! Пусть распадется этот строй щитов! Мы голыми руками одолеем их. Сейчас вы за стеной, братья мои. И я знаю, что сердце каждого из вас пылает так ярко, что стена эта защищает не нас, но наших врагов! Нам предначертана слава, но мы должны заслужить ее.'

Вы обходите войска перед боем. Произнося речь, вы смотрите им в глаза, пытаясь передать всю важность момента:^^'За мной, солдаты! Встретим врага лицом к лицом на поле брани! С такими защитниками, как вы, наши стены никогда не падут под напором этих трусливых псов! Как в старых легендах мы разнесем вражьи силы, и каждый из нас -- герой, каждый -- истинный воин! Сегодня мы досыта накормим воронов телами захватчиков!'

Вы обходите войска перед боем. Произнося речь, вы смотрите им в глаза, пытаясь передать всю важность момента:^^'Вспомните о своих детях и женах. Вспомните о своих домах и предках. Вспомните богов и все, за что мы сегодня бьемся. Мы здесь, чтобы построить новый мир! Те, кто противостоят нам, знают об этом и страшатся нашей решимости. Они не могут держать в руках копья, потому что их руки дрожат от ужаса. Солдаты! Вот я, с мечом и щитом, проливаю кровь и пот, как и вы, и я горжусь тем, что стою плечом к плечу с вами! Солдаты! Наша судьба ждет нас, и мы должны встретить ее, как подобает славным воинам!'

Вы обходите войска перед боем. Произнося речь, вы смотрите им в глаза, пытаясь передать всю важность момента:^^'Покинем стены этой крепости и встретим врага в открытом бою. Кто погибнет, встретится с нашим Богом. Кто выстоит, заслужит почет и славу. Я поведу вас в бой, и вы следуйте за мной. Господь свидетель, я никогда не оставлю вас, братья мои и рыцари!'

Вы обходите войска перед боем. Произнося речь, вы смотрите им в глаза, пытаясь передать всю важность момента:^^'Этой ночью звезда наших врагов зайдет, и ярко воссияет наша. Пусть ваши руки дрожат, но у них уже подкашиваются колени. Наши противники -- палые листья, а мы -- могучая буря, что развеет их навсегда. Мы -- гром, что расколет крону их дерева. Эта земля принадлежит нам, и эти леса, эти холмы, эти поля... Так будет и завтра, и через год, и через тысячу лет!'

К вам подезжает фермер на убогом муле. Он останавливается перед вами и кричит,^^'Свен Бычья Шея продвигается на Доккинга с тремя кораблями! Тонкрик послал меня, чтобы предупредить вас. {s4} не придет; желаю вам удачи!^Я передам эту новость другим ярлам но они Датские и не беспокоятся о Фризии. Пожалуйста, нам нужна ваша помощь. Спасите наших людей!'^^Фермер разворачивает своего мула и уезжает.Е го слова 'Спасите наших людей' звучат в вашей голове как эхо бедствия.
Продолжить

К вам голопом скачет гонец.Он останавливается перед вами переводя дыхание и кричит:^^Тонкрик желает видеть вас в Доккинга, {playername}.Он захватил в плен викингов рейдеров Свена Бычьей Шеи в последнем бою.^Он думает что вы будете заинтересовани в их допросе, и просит сообщить приедете ли вы.Тонкрик не знает как долго сможет держать их в заключении, царь и ярлы требуют их повесить.

На холме недалеко от Доккинга, вы видите как бегут горожане. Несколько храбрых мужей короля пытаются сформировать стену щитов на пляже, чтобы защищать свои земли и прикрывать отход своих близких.^^Далеко в море вы видите три военных корабля Викингов. Вы не можете их разглядеть полностью но понимаете что они полны воинов.^^Вы вспоминаете о той морской битве со Свеном Бычьей Шеей когда Свен напал на ваш корабль. Теперь наконец то он вновь в пределах досягаемости.^^Вы замечаете что из Доккинга выходит человек. Он похож на воина. Заметив вас он направляется к вам...
Прийти на помощь Доккинга и встретить воина.
Нужно нанять больше людей.
Я вернусь позже. Доккинга может подождать.
Уже поздняя ночь, и вашим людям нужен отдых. Вернуться ранним утром.
Продолжить.

По мере приближения к деревне, вы видите вереницу беженцев, покидающих Доккинга. Они идут загруженые всеми своими вещами и тянут тяжелые повозки, поэтому они двигаются очень медленно. Если вы не остановите викингов на пляже, все беженцы будут убиты от их мечей.
Войти в Доккинга.

Кровь капает с вашей руки на локоть. Вокруг вас только смерть, и ваши уши наполнены стонами и криками.^^Викинги, поверженыне, вернулись в море, оставив позади много убитых и раненых, но берег был очень высок.^^Свена Бычьей Шеи не было среди них, и это вас удивило, ибо корабли были его. Где же тогда ваш заклятейший враг?^^Слова Тонкрика резонируют в вашей голове. Похоже, самое время навестить ярла Кеннемера. Может у него есть какая-то информация.
Время, данное ярлом Кеннемером на отход из Доккинга, вышло. Тепрь вы вне закона во Фризии.
Продолжить

Это была ожесточенная битва. Бойцы Тиадерда сражались как львы, но все-таки вашему войску удалось сразить их.^^Труп Тиадерда где-то среди тел его воинов. Вы сделали своё дело; всё что осталось сделать, это собрать трофеи, которые находятся всюду вокруг.
Битва неизбежна. Тиадерд приходит в ярость увидев Регинхарда и приказывает своим воинам идти в атаку.
Поговорить с людьми.
Убить их всех, сжечь лагерь и собрать как можно больше трофеев и денег.
Ограбить логово, но пощадить обитателей.
Мы не убийцы! Оставить их в покое.
Надо нанять больше людей.
Уйти.

Морской бриз ласкает ваше лицо. Вы слышите крик чаек над головой, и запах соли становится все сильнее. В отдалении, вы различаете силуэт лодки на скрытом пляже. Это корабль, о котором Тонкрик рассказал вам ...о вашем корабле.

На берегах реки, вы различаете форт викингов . Вы нашли укрытие Свена! ^ Это хорошее место с небольшим портом для судов, легко защитить. За стеной, между домами, вы можете увидеть нескольких воинов. Вы не можете сосчитать их всех, но мне кажется их несколько десятков. ^ В середине форта, вы видите несколько заключенных, подготовленные для продажи. Может быть ваша мать среди них?
Запросить встречу с командиром форта.
Войти в форт и выкупить заключенных.
Напасть внезапно.
Все в бой!
Люди Свена наблюдают за моей армией. Нужно вернуться позже.
Завоевать укрытие Свена!
Нужно нанять больше людей.
Уйти.

Укрытие Свена Бычьей Шеи остается позади. Вы решили достигнуть своих целей средствами дипломатии, чтобы предотвратить потери в ваших рядах.^^Теперь у вас есть еще один человек в вашем отряде, старый друг, Кантабриан, Бодо. Сразу, за укрытием Свена, он просит вас пройтись с ним. Он хочет рассказать вам, что же произошло после атаки Свена на Водан Рик.
Поговорить с Бодо.

После тяжелого сражения, ваши люди победили Викингов защищающих своё укрытие. В одном из домов, вы находите пленников: двух женщин и одного мужчину. Женщин вы не знаете, возможно они пленницы с других рейдов Викингов, но мужчина, это Бодо, Кантабриан, он путешествовал вместе с вами на корабле Водан Рик.^^Бодо присоединяется к вашему отряду. Старый друг вернулся. Он просит вас пройтись вместе с ним. Он хочет рассказать вам, что же случилось после нападения Свена Бычьей Шеи на Водан Рик. Но сначала вам нужно решить что делать с укрытием Свена.
Это хорошее место. Приказать своим людям прибрать это место, пока буду говорить с Бодо.
Приказать своим людям разграбить и уничтожить это место, пока я буду разговаривать с Бодо.

Судьба играет с вами. Всё намекало на то, что ваша мать встретила свою смерть. Вами частично руководствовало желание выжить, но в основном - желание мести: найти и уничтожить Свена Бычью Шею. Но, т.к. известно что ваша мать жива и находится в руках ваших врагов, вашей главной целью теперь являются её поиски и спасение.
Выдвигаться.
После тяжелого сражения, ваши люди победили Викингов защищающих своё укрытие. Вам нужно решить с делать с укрытием.
Грязная дорога ведёт к большому забору, за которым виднеются несколько построенных домов. Похоже это процветающее место, дом багача.^Оттуда видно передвижение каких-то людей. Похоже всё тихо.
Войти в усадьбу.
Нужно нанять больше людей.

Через некоторое время зодчие уведомлеляют вас о приближении группы людей. На ферме большое напряжение царит в воздухе, но Эгиль, располагающийся на холме, показывает знак не беспокоится, потому что гости несут знамёна короля.^^Король Хорик прислал подкрепления!
Поговорить с их предводителем.

Вы пришли к выводу что ферма является хорошим местом для проведения дня-другого вдали от опасностей и сложных решений. Вы представляете что ферма ваша, вы возделываете землю, руководите рабами, и с каждым днём всё лучше и лучше. {s2}. Вы видите себя сидящим на скамейке у двери, смотрите либо закат, либо рассвет... Этого ли вы хотите? Или это будет слишком для вас? Неважно, у вас еще много дел есть, которые надо заверить перед уходом на покой.^На второй день, один из ваших зодчих уведомляет вас о приближении группы вооруженных людей. Их много и у них виднеется знамя короля Зигурда 'Змея в глазу'. Не ожидая приказа, ваши люди обнажили своё оружие, надели броню, и побежали ко входу на ферму чтобы сформировать стену из щитов.
Приступить к обмену.
Вы смотрите на людей, которые пришли. Их много, более шестидесяти, и они очень хорошо вооружены. Узника, с мешком на голове, толкают вперёд...
Войти.

после тяжелой битвы, ферма Ульфа устлана трупами. Ваши люди бродят среди тел, приканчивая раненых и забирая всё что имеет ценность. Вы смотрите на Эгила, который отрезает палец умирающему воину, чтобы снять золотое кольцо, потом на Брунхильду, у которой взгляд ужаса на лице от всеё этой резни, потом на Регинхарда, который смеётся сидя на трупе. Вы, вы не знаете что вы чувствуете. Однажды, кто-то сказал, что война меняет людей, что это ненасытный демон, который пожерает душу. Изменились ли вы? Вы другой?^^Ваши мысли прерваны обращением двух соладт, которые притащили Ольвира. Он всё еще жив, но ненадолго. Кровь течет из его бока... без остановки
Поговорить с Ольвиром.

Пока вы путешествовали, к вам присоединился один человек. В нескольких метрах, он складывает своё оружие и показывает свои руки. Вы едва его узнаёте. Это же тот самый капитан Викингов, которого вы допрашивали в Доккинге и оставили в живых.
Выслушать его.

Двое из людей Зигурда следует за тобой к Бодо, предлагая несопротивление когда вы обьясните ситуацию. Пока люди Зигурда уводят его, он останавливается перед вами, смотря на вас со слезами на глазах. Брунхильда и Регинхард, похоже, не рады вашему выбору.
Поговорить с Бодо.
Вы следуете за королём к ближайшей роще, подальше от любопытных глаз и ушей.
Поговорить с королём Хориком.
Вы следуете за королём к ближайшей роще, подальше от любопытных глаз и ушей.
Несколько человек пришли ради встречи с вами у ворот Снотингэма. Хорошо вооружены, но не похоже чтобы представляли угрозу и, кажется, они рады видеть вас.
Поговорить с ними.

Вы обзавелись своим первым кораблём. Иметь корабль еще не значит запросто пересечь море. Это способствует обогащению, если участвовать в торговле на морских путях. Если вы будете совершать налёты на прибрежные поселения, то это сделает вас пугающим человеком. Вы прослывёте завоевателем, если будете захватывать далёкие земли. Северяне даже говорят, что это даже позволит вам обрести жизнь после смерти.^^Однако, путешествие на корабле также может быть опасным. Море будто огромная открытая могила под корпусом корабля, которая ожидает вас и ваших людей. Зимние штормы будут повреждать ваши корабли, но спокойная погода не особо лучше, ибо вашим людям надо будет грести. Чтобы избежать убытков на содержании команды, можно останавливаться на отдых на берегах на ночь.^^Корабль также является оцень ценной вещью. Владельцу всегда следует не спускать глаз с него.^^Возвращайтесь сюда, когда решите что пришло время отчаливать...
Выдвигаться.

Order your men to leave their weapons outside and invite them to your great hall, to sit at your table by rank. The nearest and dearest sit closest to you. Some girls serve meat and mead in large quantities.^^You've spent a small fortune on this feast because your men deserve it. They are the ones who bleed with you, who have helped you conquer your domains. They are your faithful followers.^^The evening progresses. Many men are as drunk as vats. They shout and sing. Some run off to vomit and others fight like gamecocks to attract the attention of a girl. Behind you, a bard sings of your power and deeds.^^You act like a warlord. You are a warlord... a 'shepherd of men.'
Вы созываете ваших людей и раздаёте им кольца и браслеты (2000 шиллингов).
{s10} Your very own refuge, a hidden retreat free from enemies, where you can hide when things go badly, rest from your travels, or save your most personal of treasures.^^{s11}^^{s13}
Мои люди заслужили банкет.
Переименовать ваше убежище.
Направится в хол убежища.
Ворота убежища.
Пойти в таверну.
Дверь в таверну.
Поговорить с капитаном.
Ворота в ваше убежище.
Нанять персонал.
Прогуляться по вашему убежищу.
Отправиться на площадь.
Управление гарнизоном.
Снести ваше убежище.
Подождать некоторое время.
Уйти...
Покинуть это место.
Вы уверены что хотите разрушить своё убежище?
Да (1000 шиллингов).
Вернуться.
После привала, ваши компаньоны подошли к вам, с Брунхильдой во главе. Она хочет что-то сказать.
Выслушать Брунхильду.
После привала, ваши компаньоны подошли к вам. На их лицах обеспокоенность.
Выслушать их.
После привала, ваши компаньоны подошли к вам, с Бодо во главе. Он хочет что-то сказать.
Выслушать Бодо.
Вас уведомили, что пришел один человек, чтобы встретиться с вами. Это долговязый парень, выглядящий радостно. Определенно, это сын старого Римлянина.
Продолжить.

Your men have notified you that someone is coming towards you. It is a single figure, who advances without hiding and with full confidence. He is a tall man, robust and of proud bearing. When he arrives before your men, he shows open hands, so all can see that he is not armed. He seeks you with his eyes and walks towards you. One of your men stops him with his spear...
Continue.

On one side of the road, a man is awaiting sitting on a big rock. He is thin, tall, and is dressed in poor clothing. He seems harmless enough. Calmly, the stranger waits until you come close to him. His eyes are searching through the faces of your men until they stop on you, then he gets up and walks to you.
Talk to him.
It seems that something is wrong. You hear screaming and see that Egil is heading your way.
Listen to Egil.

Egil's body lies at your feet, delivered to eternal sleep. Some of your followers take his body away for burial. Egil was a beloved member of your party, and his death weighs heavily among your warriors.
Join the men who bury Egil and pay the costs of his burial.
Allow them to bury Egil.
Egil moves toward you. The men close around the two of you. It's you or him...
Fight.
Continue

The smell of the sea is pervasive in this area, and the rumble of the waves crash against the cliffs resonates in your head like thunder. There is a path, very narrow at the end of a beach, where you distinguish traces of men. It is a difficult way that you can only follow on your own, so you order your people to wait behind while you investigate.
I need to recruit more men.

You move from the farm to a clearing, where Ulf's thralls are preparing a ritual circle of stones that mark the boundary of the dueling area. Around you, all the men from the farm and your men form another circle to cheer you on.^^In front of you, Orm The Black warms his oversized muscles. He seems confident. Perhaps, given his spotless record of wins, he can't be said to be too confident. Your companions give you pats on the back, advice and wishes for good luck. All but Reginhard, who is pessimistic and says he will record the runes on your gravestone. Suddenly, Egil points toward Orm. The berserker has ceased to warm up his muscles. His body convulses uncontrollably, and his mouth foams white. Suddenly, he lifts his head and, looking at you with bloodshot eyes, shouts something unintelligible. He launches himself towards you like a viper, much more quickly than one would expect from such a large man...
Jump to the fray.

Orm the Black's corpse lies at your feet. Your arms are sore from blocking the brutality of his attacks, and your mind keeps replaying the more desperate moments of the duel. You wonder at the fury of Orm and his apparent immunity to pain. There's no doubt you're lucky, for you have just survived a fight with a berserker!
The duel is over, and you have defeated {s1}. The skalds will talk about your victory, and the fame of your feat will spread by the word of mouth.

{s1} was an opponent too skilled for you. You have been defeated. While {s1}'s fame will grow from the victory, thanks to the songs of the skalds, men will remember your name only as that of the beaten.
Accept the challenge.

The duel is over. Your enemy lies on the ground, defeated by your skill with weapons. You hope that this serves as a warning to other potential rivals. Now your mission is to restore confidence and improve your army's morale.

A messenger approaches, beating his horse. He stops in front of you, takes a breath and shouts,^^'My King, Horik of Danmark, invites you to The Assembly being held near Ribe. Since it is going to be about your complaint with Sven Bull Neck and Sigurd Ragnarsson, you must go soon, or the judgement of The Assembly will go against you.'^^The messenger then kicks his mount and rides away.
Continue

A group of heavily armed men approach you. They are led by Harald Haraldsson, king's right hand, who reminds you of your promise at The Assembly. It is the hour of the holmgang and your opponent is already on Short Island. They surround your party and lead you to a nearby beach, where a gaunt old man waits in a small boat. You get in the boat, and two of Harald's men push it into the water. The old man, without a word to you, begins paddling toward an island on the horizon.
Continue.

The water is gentle. The only sound you hear is that of the oars on the water, striking in a slow and deliberate rhythm. The old man is not so old, but wrinkles of a hard life at sea make him look like an elder. He wears a worn and salt-bleached tunic, and the skin of his hands look like hard leather. His eyes are blue and crystal clear and do not look directly at you even for a moment, but remain focused on the island. Up ahead awaits an opponent who once was a companion. The Assembly has decided that two go to Short Island, but only one return. The boat stops near a small beach, and after you get off, the old man paddles it a few tens of meters back into the ocean, where he stops and waits.
Duel.

'Two went to the island, but only one returns.'^^You have been victorious, but at the cost of killing an old companion. In your mind, you remember the phrase that you heard so often from Reginhard: Gaed a wyrd swa hio scel!, Fate always goes as she must!^^The old man takes the boat back to where your warriors await in Danmark. When you arrive, they pick up their things and say nothing, aware of the gravity of the moment. Soon they are ready to go. Harald and his men have already left. It's time to look for The Assembly judge called Asbjorn in the mead hall of Ribe.

In a setting reminiscent of times past, when men lifted huge rocks to venerate their dead or glorify their gods, meets The Assembly. As you approach, you hear more clearly hundreds of voices, distinguish the tents, and smell the food from the merchant stands. The Assembly, or The Thing, is not just a meeting where issues are discussed and judgements are made but also an event where people around go to exchange news or sell their products.
Approach.
Leave.
Finally, after you prepared yourself carefully for the long journey, the fleet rows out of Ribe, leaving Danmark behind to follow the Whale Route.

By now the differences between Sven Bull Neck, protected by Jarl Sigurd, and Harald Haraldsson, protected by King Horik, are so clear that the fleet progresses divided in two, depending on who supports which commander.^^But it's not the time for worry. The sea brings wind and the freedom of the waves, and your ship is heading for Englaland where rivers carry silver and men get fame. And now you're closer than ever to Sven Bull Neck. You just wait for your chance to kill him and rescue your mother... Fate always rewards the patient.

The journey from Ribe to Eoferwic or, as the Danish call it, Jorvik is three days with good weather, but with the slower knorrs, the trip will take a day or two more. The ships have spread out, but this is usual. When traveling with sail, the winds govern at will. The ships will reunite at their destination.^^A long trip like this requires a routine. Men take turns in the work of the boat, even at night, because the fleet never stops offshore. The smell of the crowded men is horrible, the water you drink and food you eat taste terrible, and it is always uncomfortable having to peer over the stern when you want to relieve yourself.^^Eventually, the rift between Harald and Sven becomes open. Each now meets separately with the captains who are faithful to him. Each part of the fleet proceeds separately. Harald has called you and the other captains to his boat for an emergency meeting. Apparently, one of the captains faithful to Sven Bull Neck has changed his allegiance to Harald and brings news.^^You look forward to the meeting as well. Maybe there is finally news of your mother.
Captains' meeting.

Behind you fades the battle, the pitiful cries of the wounded, and the clash of swords. You leave behind Harald Haraldsson's army while Sven Bull Neck's men massacre them. Your mission now is go to Englaland to find Rathbarth Ragnarsson to tell him what happened and how Sven Bull Neck betrayed the king's men.
Flee.

You gather the fleet and immediately the sailors cast off the boats and pull the halyards to raise the sails. The cloth is stirred, moved by the morning breeze, and the ships begin to move while the captains shout orders to the crew, which start to row. Moved by sail and oars, the fleet leaves the harbor to sail in open water.

You spend days at sea, uncomfortable on a boat with so many men, where there is no space for privacy and tranquillity. The smell of stale sweat, urine and sebum fills the air, even above the salty scent of the sea.^The climate is mild: no storms, no wind, despite the early appearance of fog. In fact, with so little wind, the fleet advances slowly, making the trip longer.^^Finally, from a nearby ship, one of the lookouts points to the horizon, and you can see Douar-an-Enez. In the bay of the village, there are more than 40 boats, many of them in the sea, lashed together in battle formation. One ship leaves the group and heads towards you...
Join the parley.

Behind you, you hear discussion in the village. There seems to be dissension in the camp of the Astures. You hear swords and shouting.^^But none of that matters to you at the moment. In full sail, a Cantabrian ship takes you to where your boat awaits. You see, in the distance, your fleet maneuvering to confront their attackers. Gundinsalvo travels with you. He is serious, very serious, despite the buffoonery at the meeting. He looks to where the two fleets jockey for position with their oars. His face is fierce, that of a seasoned warrior who does not fear death. As soon as your ship arrives, it rows toward your fleet. It's time to take control...
To battle.

The sea has become a hell of fire, blood and death. Victory is yours, but many have been left behind, overcome by the edge of the sword, including the Cantabrian, Gundinsalvo.^^The naval battle was pure delirium of madness, but now your enemies flee. They are seeking to take refuge in Douar-an-Enez, but your warriors have pursued them, sparking a new battle in the little village. It is where you left Bodo, who attempts to bring together the Asturians and coordinate their efforts.^^It's your turn to join the fight...
Disembark.

Douar-an-Enez is not the place it was when you first arrived. Now there are only fire and death... Its inhabitants have been turned over to torment, and you doubt that someday someone would dare repopulate this cursed place.^^You hear the plaintive cry of your own injured people, and men wander past you staring into the distance, still shocked by the battle. You remember how Bodo died in the fight and last time you shared with him. His mission failed with persistent inevitability. There is no longer a fleet from the kingdom of Asturias, only a few Cantabrians who have joined your cause after losing their own leader, Gundinsalvo. Now you are their leader. Some of your men dedicate themselves to finishing off the enemy and seizing their possessions.
Claim your share of the spoils.
Let your men keep all the loot.

On a hill, the Danish have built a small camp. Counting the number of tents that you can see, you figure that there are between 250 and 300 men. On one of the tents waves the banner of Bjorn, one of the most famous sons of Ragnar.^^A couple of men stop you, but they let you pass as soon as you identify yourself, as if they were advised of your arrival.
Enter the camp.
Investigate.

Down in the distance, you see two Saxon and Angle camps surrounding Snotingaham. The camps are large, capable of holding thousands of men, and there are also patrols of warriors around the perimeter of the city, making sure that no one goes in or out. From this far away, you can just distinguish the silhouettes of Danish warriors as they patrol around the walls of the fortress. They are certainly in a compromising situation in terms of numbers, and the food is running out every day.
Go to Snotingaham, passing between Mierce patrols.
I need to recruit more men.
You leave behind Snotingaham and return to the forest...
Go to Snotingaham, passing between Mierce patrols.

As you approach Snotingaham, Saxon patrols surround you but do not attack, respecting your emissary flag. They make you wait for about an hour while they look for Aelfred.^^Finally, a group of riders reaches where you are, dismounts and walks up to you.
Continue.

While your party rests to recover from the fatigue of the road, you take advantage to get away a bit from the camp and to have some privacy, as you have an upset stomach.^^But your relaxation, hidden among some rocks, is disturbed by a noise to your right...
Quickly dress and take up your weapon.
It has been thirty days, and you've managed to keep {s3}. It is time to return for news of Sven Bull Neck and the decision regarding the letter of Bodo.

A messenger approaches, beating a squalid horse. He stops in front of you, takes a breath and shouts,^^'This message is for somebody called {playername}. If you want news of your mother, go to Boar Grove near Dommoc and look for the lumberjack's house.'^^The messenger kicks his mount until it starts moving again and rides off.
Continue
Your eyes distinguish a special place, which seemingly looks like it has been raised by the ancients. Perhaps it is a good time to visit and enjoy the art of another time.
Go.
Approach.
Not far away there is a bridge over a stream. The stream itself is unnamed, but the bridge is widely known as The Troll's Bridge.
Move towards the bridge.

Nearby you see a house surrounded by a row of stones on the ground. It seems an idyllic place to live, surrounded by peace and tranquillity, with nary a concern but to get up and take care of the livestock or crops... It is therefore impossibly distant from your hectic itinerant life on the road.
Enter.
Following the path, you can see ruins of some ancient Roman fort, similar to those found in other parts of old Britannia.
Investigate.
You arrive at a small hamlet along the way. Smoke rises from a chimney, but you do not see anyone outside.
Visit the hamlet.
You arrive at a deep grove of woods. {s4}

The Saxon army has retreated to this position to regroup after the defeat at Readingum. They have set up camp on a hill, where they are reinforced with men who arrive every day. It's a good position to recover and to intercept the Danish army in their westward advance before they can penetrate into West Seaxe.^^The site is called Aescesdun.^^{s4}
Enter the camp.
The camp has been almost empty, with very few people left after the advance of the great army into battle.

Ragnar's sons have build a fortified camp in a Saxon village called Readingum. The site has good defenses and a moat, and there are still remnants of the earlier battle in which the Saxons tried to expel the Danish. It is a good position from which to defend and protect the surroundings.^^{s4}
Enter the camp.
Join them.

The Danish army, the Great Summer Army, has reached Aescendun. King Aethelred has divided his army in two: one led by himself and the other in the hands of his brother, young Aelfred. Each division takes one side of the ancient road, the Ridgeway. While the Vikings deploy, Aethelred decides that he must pray before the battle and refuses to budge until the service is complete. But the Danish approach quickly, their army also split in two...

The Saxon army has taken a vantage point on two hills, split in two. One of the hills is dominated by the troops of King Aethelred and the other by those of Aelfred. The Danish move quickly, more than expected, not stopping to rest or form up. This is something that Aethelred did not anticipate. He is still immersed in his prayers and has ordered not to be disturbed until finished. The Danish don't wait. They divide their own army into two in their advance. One division under the army leaders, Jarl Halfdan and King Bagsecg, heads straight for the hosts of Aethelred. The other, under five other jarls, moves in the direction of Aelfred. They start to seize the high ground on a hill above the Saxon positions. If they finish deploying, they will have the height advantage over their enemies...^^{s2} You have {reg10} troops fit for battle against their {reg11}.
Battle of Aescesdun.

On the way down the battlefield, all you've seen are the remains of weapons, corpses, wounded men, looters, priests giving final unction to the dying, and you feel something inside that mixes the euphoria of remaining alive with strong sense of desolation. Above all, you ask one recurring question: why? Why am I alive when so many others died?^^But your thoughts and fate walk in different directions. {s4}
Talk to him.

Attracted by the growth of your army, some priests and women have joined you lately, and now even some merchants are asking for permission to follow you.^^Although this means easy access to many services that undoubtedly will improve the morale of your men, you should know that groups like that move slow and will in turn make your army slower.^^The followers' services are accessible from within your camp area.
Sure. They are welcome.
No. This is an army, not a puppet show.
Recent events and the drastic reduction in the number of your men have caused your camp followers disperse...
Damn.
Are you sure you want to disperse your followers? This will make your followers stop accompanying your army. This may mean a strong negative impact on the morale of your men.
Yes.
No.
The site has good defenses and moat, and there are still remnants of the previous battle, when the Saxons tried to expel the Danish. It is a good position to defend.^^{s4}
Talk to him.
Get closer to Readingum.
Total Assault!
Leave.

The slaughter continues in Readingum, your men still fighting against the remnants of the Sven's troops, but that is not the battle you seek. Sven Bull Neck has barricaded himself in the mead hall of Readingum, taking your mother and a few men with him. It's time to end this party...
Enter the mead hall.

Sven Bull Neck finally lies dead. You have accomplished your revenge, but you are left with a bitter taste in your mouth, because your mother's dead body is laying not far from Sven's. The woman who raised you, and for who you left everything behind to seek a healer in Friese. Her last words of love resonate in your mind, like a distant echo.^^Sven Bull Neck and your mother have been the energy that has driven you so far, but both are now dead. You feel a void, as if part of you went with them.^^After everything that happened, all you have left are memories...
Hold a funeral.
One of your advisers tells you that he has found rats in the provisions that your men are eating. This could have been avoided with some sanitation preventions!
I cannot leave my men without food. Kill as many rats as you can.
Before all the rats are exterminated, many of your men fall sick and die.^^Your casualties: {s8}
Done.
Poor hygiene in your camp has led to dysentery. The men start dying all around you. This could have been avoided with some sanitation preventions!
Hire a physician to try to help the people who have contracted the disease (1000 penings).
There is nothing I can do.
Pray to your god.
I or my companions can cure them.
Death governs your camp. Many of your men are sick and dying.^^Your casualties: {s8}
Damn.
Some men die from the disease, but most manage to recover thanks to the physician you hired.^^Your casualties: {s8}
Death governs your camp. Many of your men are sick and dying. Perhaps your god has saved some lives.^^Your casualties: {s8}
Done.
Thanks to your healing abilities, you manage to save many men, but some still die.^^Your casualties: {s8}
Back to siege.
There is so much garbage, vermin and other nasties that your camp seems more of a pigsty. Your men are unhappy. This could have been avoided with some sanitation preventions!
I will give an inspiring speech to gain time while I take measures.
I will see what I can do.
Some enemies have managed to infiltrate at night and burn some of your supplies. Part of your food was destroyed.
To set an example, punish the men who were on duty that night.
No, do nothing!
During the night, your men captured and executed a group of enemies who tried to infiltrate and burn supplies.
Congratulate them for doing their job well.
Reward each one of them with a warrior bracelet (300 penings).
Reward them with a night off and money to spend at the nearest brothel (200 penings).
Do nothing. You are a firm leader, and will not show weakness.
Sir, our food supply routes may be in danger. Our scouts have discovered enemy raiders behind our lines.^We could avoid such problems by blockading the place.
Send men to protect the routes and pursue the enemy (Troops will be taken from your main army).
Send messengers to pay them not to attack your supply routes (500 penings but no guarantees).
Do nothing (lose part of your food but save your men's lives).

Dispatch a group of men to protect and pursue the enemies that plague your supply routes. Your men attempt to corner the enemy to force him to fight until death. There are some losses, but your men manage to win the battle and secure the supply routes.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
Well done.
Our scouts have found that the defenders have poisoned the water with dead animals.
Buy water and ask the merchants to bring it via our supply route (600 penings).
Ration water and digging of wells.
Without water the siege can not continue. Abandon the siege.

Water is running out, and your men are weakened. Driven by the madness of thirst, some of them drink poisoned water and die. Finally, a well is completed and you get water for the time being. You can continue the siege.^^Your casualties from poisoned water:{s8}
Fate is inexorable.
Bad news: one of our men has deserted to the enemy. It may be because of his low morale or because they have offered him money. Whatever it is, the enemy may know our plans.
Offer 400 penings to the army to raise morale. I don't want more desertions.
Do not worry. I can always change plans.
A deserter from the enemy has joined our ranks. He has informed us that {s2}.
He is welcome to our ranks.
I do not want deserters among my men. Kill him.
I'm sure he's a spy. Return him to the enemy.
Our men and the enemy do not insult each other as much any more, and sometimes talk to each other. This can affect their fighting spirit when we attack. What shall we do?
Allow it. The enemy's fighting spirit is also affected.
What? Forbid it and punish the offenders.
The cold of winter always takes its toll when it comes. Some men have died of cold, flu and other minor illnesses.^^Your casualties: {s8}
Requiescat in pace.
A farmer comes to you and says that one of your men has raped his daughter, who lives in a village near your siege camp. The farmer wishes wergild (compensation) of 100 penings. What do you do?
Pay the wergild.
Refuse to pay for damage done to the Enemy.
Kill the farmer and his daughter.
In revenge the men of the nearby villages joined together and attacked your foraging parties.^^Your casualties: {s8}
A group of enemies attacked our men by surprise and then quickly withdrew.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
This is common. Be cautious. (Blockade the place, and the problem will go away immediately).
While foraging, a group of enemy riders encountered a group of our men.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
This is common. Be cautious. (Blockade the place, and the problem will go away immediately).
We were attacked by an enemy force while raiding neighboring villages. The villagers joined the enemy, causing us many casualties.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
This is common. Be cautious. (Blockade the place, and the problem will go away immediately).
The enemy and our men came upon each other near a river, and the fight for water caused numerous casualties on both sides.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
This is common. Be cautious. (Blockade the place, and the problem will go away immediately).
The enemy sallied out through a secret passage, attacking us before swiftly retreating back to the protection of their walls.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
This is common. Be cautious. (Blockade the place, and the problem will go away immediately).
Some of your men have abducted women from the surrounding villages and brought them to the siege camp for fun.
You allow it and ask for the most beautiful woman.
Order your men to release the women and punish the kidnappers.
The enemy is trying to break our blockade, and our men are trying to contain them.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
Send some men to reinforce the wall, while I make a threat of assault. This will force them to withdraw.
Quick. Send all the men to protect that part of the circumvallation.
Do not worry, our wall is strong.
The enemy has overcome our defenses and burned our small camps and checkpoints, breaking our blockade.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
We must build the blockade again.
We have managed to repel the enemy, who returned to the protection of his walls...^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
Another group of enemies took advantage of our troops being here and set fire to another part of our blockade.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
The enemy is trying to burn our assault equipment.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
Hurry up. I want to send a detachment of men to reinforce the equipment zone while making a threat of assault, forcing them to withdraw.
Quickly. Send all men to protect the equipment.
Do not worry. Our men will guard it.
The enemy has overcome our defenses and burned down our equipment.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
We have managed to repel the enemy, who returned to the protection of his walls.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
Well done.
Another group of enemies has surrounded our positions and burned down our siege equipment on the other side.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
Damn!
Your guards discovered several men trying to sneak out at night to escape your blockade.
Allow them to escape.
Kill them.
At night, your guards let you know that they have seen a group of enemies dressed in sheepskins. Right now enemies are filling bottles along the river to bring water to the settlement.
Go there with any companions who want to join.
Ambush the enemy in sheepskins.
Do nothing.
Your soldiers surrounded the enemy in sheepskins and fell upon them by surprise, spreading death.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
Perfect!

It's a trap! Sir, the men dressed in sheepskins were a decoy to bring out our men and ambush them. Many were killed before returning to the protection of our circumvallation.^^Your casualties: {s8}^^Enemy casualties: {s9}
That is terrible.
Your soldiers were deployed to surround the enemy, but they were too slow and noisy. The men in sheepskins sensed the threat and returned to the settlement quickly.
Well, next time.
Today a mercenary who wants to join our ranks came to our camp. He says he is an exile from the place that we are besieging, and he wants revenge.
Accept him.
I don't need more men.
We have accumulated the heads of enemies and dead peasants. Do you want to launch them over the walls to undermine the morale of the enemy and cause disease?
What? You're a crazy maniac. Do not do that!
Sure, it will be useful when negotiating their surrender.

The heads are launched into the settlement. From the outside, you hear the cries and tears of the citizens when they recognize a loved one. War is merciless, and you've proven you're the most terrible of foes.
This will help them give up... or die...
A merchant offers a group of dancers to entertain your men during the night.
I need my men ready for action, not distracted or tired.
Hire dancers just for yourself (100 penings).
Your men deserve it. Hire dancers for them (500 penings).

A group of bandits approaches your camp. As your men reach for their arms, the bandits put down their weapons and say they come in peace. The leader of the bandits steps forward and asks if they may join you.
Of course! My warband always welcomes men of such talent and promise!
I'm sorry, we have no room for your kind!
Prove yourselves worthy of my attention by raiding a village and bringing me the chief's head!
Kill them all!
After two hours, the bandits return with some loot and someone's head...
Several merchants approach you wanting to sell goods in the camp that has formed close to yours with the wives of the soldiers, prostitutes, refugees, children and other followers of the army.
They (and their money) are welcome.
There are enough merchants already.
Kill them and steal their money.
To make the food last longer, the defenders threw out their women, children and elderly. You can see them moving towards your circumvallation, begging for food.
Send a party of soldiers to kill the children and elderly, taking the women for your men.
Buy food and give it to the beggars. (1000 penings). Then let them leave.
Do not give them anything. Allow them to die of starvation at the gate of their home!
One of your soldiers, angered by the long siege, rapes the wife of one of your officers.
Ignore the situation.
Punish the soldier.
Execute the soldier.
Pay wergild (compensation) to the officer (1000 penings).
Your officer kills the soldier and there is a brawl between some friends of the soldier and those loyal to your officer, leaving some dead.
That is terrible.

A messenger approaches, galloping. He stops in front of you, takes a breath and shouts:^^'My masters sent me to tell you that the messenger you sent to {s9} was found dead on the side of the road. We're sorry to inform you that your message never reached its destination. We will be at your disposal for any other message that you need to send. You know where to find us.'
Continue.

A messenger approaches, galloping. He stops in front of you, takes a breath and shouts:^^'My masters sent me to tell you that the messenger you sent to {s9} was found dead on the side of the road. We're sorry to inform you that your message never reached its destination. We will be at your disposal for any other message that you need to send. You know where to find us.'
Bad luck.
Thank for your service.
Events

Two farmers, one very tall and lanky, the other low and stocky, were presented to you to discuss the ownership of a calf. Apparently their fields bordered each other and the tall farmer had a bull that impregnated a cow belonging to the other. The stocky farmer said the calf was his because it was his cow giving birth. The tall farmer claimed the calf to be his, being the offspring of his best bull, or at least get financial compensation.
The owner of the cow is right. The calf is his, just like the cow is.
The owner of the bull is right. The bull is his and the calf too.
The owner of the cow keeps the calf and pays compensation to the owner of the bull.
Neither is right. I'll slaughter the calf for its meat and give some to my men!
Neither is right. Kill the calf and give the meat to both farmers!

My {reg59?lady:lord}, we captured a murderer! This is the man who attacked one of our messengers in {s4}, who is lying seriously injured in bed. This doesn't show us in a good light, for the messenger was under your protection. However, the attacker has an interesting story, and he wishes to talk to you before his execution.^^The prisoner's story: 'My {reg59?lady:lord}, I would have never thought of attacking your messenger, but that man wished to sleep with my young daughter at night, and this offer was refused! However, he did not accept our answer, entered my house with three friends, and raped my dear daughter, laughingly telling me all the while that you would never believe the word of a commoner. A father must protect his only child!'
The messenger was under my protection. You and your family will be executed at dawn.
I will be reasonable: only you will be hanged.
While the messenger was my servant, I would have done the same. You can go.
I order the messenger to be hanged. No one should take advantage of their position.

You summon two men to decide a dispute between them. One is a local leader, while the other is a farmer who rents the land of the leader.^^The man says his harvest was poor and cannot pay the rent, so the leader took the farmer's daughter to his own bed and as a servant in his house. The local leader is an influential figure within {s4}.
Punish the farmer. He must pay rent to his lord.
Punish the local leader. He has no right to take the farmer's daughter.
Kill the noble and force the farmer to join your army for not paying his taxes.
Compensate the noble yourself for the tribute and send the girl back.

Not satisfied with your decision, the farmer pulls out his seax and pounces on the local leader, killing him before your men can do anything. Then he turns to you and says, 'This is justice, bastard!' Then with the same seax, he kills himself.

One of your sworn men approaches you. He states his fears that, among the men, there is much dissatisfaction. Reason being that you are too placid and that there is too little gold and honour to be won in your service.
Pay the men and give rings to them.
Tell the men that they are released from their oaths if they are so stupid as to leave.
Kill the man who approached you in front of the rest and state there shall be no more talk of sedition.
Promise to change your leadership style, making sure to mention that the next big plunder is just round the corner.

In {s4}, a man is brought before you. Your men inform you that he refuses to pay taxes to the kingdom, and therefore to you. The man insists that he will not pay taxes until the kingdom gives him back his boys, all of them killed in recent wars.
This man has already lost enough. Forgive his taxes for life.
Punish this man with death if he does not pay. You cannot allow the precedent.
Pay the man a wergeld for the death of his boys and promise that their names will be remembered.
Suddenly, the room where you exercise your legal authority is crowded with people who have lost sons to war, all demanding equal treatment.

Two men come to you. Your men say they are ready to kill each other. One of them has cut some old oaks that were blocking traffic on the way, but they were actually within the borders of the estate of the other.^^'Those trees made the passage of my cart difficult!' exclaims the first one. 'We are only talking about trees. I do not understand this suit!'^^'Those trees were on my land, planted by my father, recently deceased,' shouts the other.
The man who cut the trees must pay to the other in compensation.
Trees hindered the way. They had to be cut.
The man who cut the trees must pay to the other in compensation and to you as punishment.
The harvest this year promises to be very bad, which means starvation for the winter. What should we do?
Buy some wagons of grain from other places. It is the least I can do (1000 penings).
I do not have enough money to buy food elsewhere.
Serves them right for not tending to their crops carefully enough!

One of the local leaders approaches you stating that he has an illegitimate son (whom he favours) who wishes to join your captains. You agree to meet the boy, as it would be unseemly to flat out reject a noble. When you meet the boy, however, it is clear that he is a homebody; certainly not warrior material. Faced with this plump, smiling youth do you:
Allow him to join your captains.
Ask for payment to grease the deal.
Refuse. Only the best will serve as captains.

Two proposals come before you one day. One is from a scholarly young priest called Osberh, who proposes building a church in {s4}. He promises to instruct you in new knowledge that will increase your intelligence in return.^^Another man, upon hearing this, pushes himself before you. He is a hulking, great-bearded warrior who overshadows Osberh completely. He suggests the funds would be better used on a training camp, and he promises to teach you a trick to increase your physical prowess.
Choose Osberh's idea. You need to improve your intelligence.
Choose the warrior. You need improve your strength.
I have enough money to build both facilities (3000 penings).
Hah! You have enough intelligence already not to fall for either one.

A searing flash is seen across the night sky. There is much talk of omens the next day. Among the people of {s4} there is a general consensus that some act of sacrifice must be committed or some divine wrath shall befall the kingdom. The practise of the wickerman suddenly gains impetus, as it is near harvest time. They find an angelic girl, and she is treated as a living goddess until just before harvest. Suddenly you discover that the whole place has recovered traditions lost for centuries.
Allow the sacrifice of the girl.
Forbid the sacrifice and take the girl into your party for safety.
This is no affair of yours.

A runner arrives at your court, and after you allow it, starts to tell dire news. 'My {reg59?lady:lord}, a nearby village is in great danger! The populace has some kind of strange sickness, they can hardly move, sweat and vomit, and the local wise-woman has no cure for it. The local leader doesn't let anyone out at the moment and is expecting your orders!'
Quarantine!, but I will pay to send the best area physicians to help! (500 penings)
Quarantine! We will examine the survivors when the epidemic is over!

Two nuns approach you. 'My {reg59?lady:lord}, we have a childbirth that is not going well! We tried everything we could, but it seems that the young lady is simply not suited for pregnancy. The girl is the daughter of a prominent local lord. What can we do?'
Everybody, kneel down and start praying!
Guards: Bring me the wise-woman from the village, NOW!

One day, a loyal noble from nearby comes to you with a strange request. 'My lord, I am in a very bad situation. I spent all my money on proper equipment and troops, so that I can serve you well. However, my first daughter is about to marry, and I cannot send a proper dowry with her to the husband'.
Take this small amount of silver for your faithful service (800 penings).
I will help you now, but this is the last time (400 penings).
No, you should have saved up the money up front!

One day, a Christian missionary arrives at your doorstep. He is very enthusiastic. 'My {reg59?lady:lord}, I have splendid news! There is a merchant from Jerusalem in {s4} now, and he is willing to sell us a piece of the Holy Cross! I cannot believe that we have the opportunity to own such a famous relic! And this would help me so much to spread the word of Christ to the faithful!'
I have seen many parts of the Holy Cross. We don't pay for fake relics!
Sorry, but this place worships other gods. I won't waste my money.
We cannot let this opportunity slip! (5000 penings)

You are having a feast with your companions when a messenger comes to your attention, 'My {reg59?lady:lord}, there is a situation in {s4} that needs your counsel.' Excusing yourself, you step outside.^^A crowd has gathered there, arguing, but when you appear, it quickly falls silent. An elder bows to you and asks permission to speak, which you give. He speaks: 'My {reg59?lady:lord}, we need your wisdom. There are two women who claim to be the mother of this child, neither desist.'^Two women are presented. One is in fine clothes and the other in rags.
Give the child to the poor woman.
Give the child to the rich woman.
Order to cut the child in half and give each half to one of the women.

Then the woman in rags screams and says, 'No, please my {reg59?lady:lord}, let the other women have the child then.'^^Then the elder near you exclaims, 'So you are the rightful mother and this child belongs to you!'^^The other woman seems uneasy, 'I can give that child a better life than always living in poverty'.
Give the child to the poor woman and punish the rich woman for lying.
Give the child to the poor woman and the rich woman to the crowd.
Give the child to the rich woman and poor woman to your men.
Your advisor, streaked with dirt and sunburned, arrives after inspecting the harvest. 'My Lord, the harvest is poor this year. If you do not reduce taxes there will be starvation this winter.'
Less taxes means releasing men from their oaths. Better an empty gut than a cut throat.
Well, I will compensate for their shortfall from my purse (1000 penings).

A peasant from a nearby village comes to you as a supplicant. He breathlessly reports that armed men have raided his farm, carrying off women, cattle and grain. He is spattered with blood and stinks of burned thatch.
Hire watchmen to guard the area (300 penings).
There is nothing to be done here. Away with you, mongrel!
There will be war. Take this money and rebuild your village.

A happy widow is accused of witchcraft after several oathmen sworn to your vassal report pain while relieving themselves. Your vassal backs their claim. You suspect he has the same complaint but knows better than to air it publicly.
Banish the happy widow, exiling her to another place.
Pay the witch and to have her help counteract the spread of Christianity.
Where there's one, there's many! Kill anyone else reported for witchcraft.

A missionary comes upon you and tells you of one of your villages where he was introducing God's grace. When he and his followers wanted to fell a ancient tree important to the pagans, most of the inhabitants took up arms and drove them out.
This missionary is right: cut down this heretical tree.
This missionary is wrong. Have him and his followers burn for the Gods.
This missionary is wrong. Have those Christians abandon this village in peace.
A woman from a nearby village comes to you claiming that one of your men who died recently was her husband. She asks for assistance to take care of the remains.
Give her monetary assistance and send for a priest.
Do nothing. This isn't my problem.
Unluckily, I do not have money for this.

The most important local leader comes to you with a request. 'My {reg59?lady:lord}, would it not show your great mercy and honor to provide for those who have suffered while serving under you? We have dozens of maimed, lame and aged ex-warriors begging for coin in the streets and many families who have lost fathers and husbands in your battles. We need to reward and protect your loyal supporters, or else men might be hesitant in the future to be in your shield wall.
It isn't my fault my men don't save their wealth for their families.
We should support our veterans and their families (800 penings).
Open my coffers and all families shall receive support from their {reg59?lady:lord} (2000 penings).
I have no money for this unexpected expense.

A seemingly straightforward case is brought before you. Yesterday, the accused man broke into the victim's house and removed large amounts of wealth. Many people saw him, and the missing items were discovered in his house. But the victim is an influential supporter of the previous lord, had actually served as a councillor and was known to be of doubtful loyalties. The accused, on the other hand, happens to be one of your most vocal supporters and has donated much money to your cause.
Ignoring the evidence, you settle in your man's favor.
The evidence is clear and the accused is found guilty.
Both parties are in the wrong. You exile them and confiscate all material pertaining to the case.

A seemingly straightforward case is brought before you. Yesterday, the accused man broke into the victim's house and removed large amounts of wealth. Many people saw him, and the missing items were discovered in his house. But the victim is an influential supporter of the previous lord, had actually served as a councillor and was known to be of doubtful loyalties. The accused, on the other hand, happens to be one of your most vocal supporters and has donated much money to your cause.

Your relation with {s4} is very bad. As you walk its streets, people look at you hatefully and make gestures behind your back. You get beyond a corner, and you're safe -- until several people begin to emerge. Ordinary citizens are tired of your government and begin to insult you. Finally, someone becomes bold enough to pull a knife and attack you.
Defend yourself.

A group of your warriors walking the streets have been attacked and killed by an angry mob who insulted your name and blamed them for all their ills. You should improve your relations with {s4} as soon as possible.
Order your men to kill the perpetrators and seize their possessions.
I will not rule by fear. I have to improve relations by other means.
Exterminate the population of the entire city and repopulate it with more loyal people.
Events
Events

The sound of a galloping horse pierces the cold morning, and you run outside to find a watchman dismounting. He tells you that a strange ship carrying men who speak a foreign language has been shipwrecked on the coast nearby. What do you do?
Send warriors to search for valuables. If there are any survivors, kill them.
Send a warband to investigate. If there are any survivors, recruit them.
Do nothing.
Continue.
You've heard that a bard has composed a song about your noble deeds.
Reward him with 300 penings. Let this song be played across the land.
Tales of your successes spread around the country. Everywhere you go, your procession is surrounded by beggars.
Allocate 200 penings to an alms fund.
Ignore them.
Beggars huh? Release the hounds!
A young noble spreads rumors about your mother. Accusations of working in the world's oldest profession are the more delicate ones.
I challenge him to a duel!
It's just talk.

You encounter one of your soldiers' wives. She begs you to release her husband from his contract. The harvest was poor this year, and his wages can't feed the whole family. If he could come back and work on the field, they might survive.
This can't be! Here, take 200 penings.
You release her husband from his duties.
A local naysayer is spreading false rumors about you. While most of the stories are just pure nonsense, sooner or later people will believe them.
Let him say what he wants. Every man has his rights.
Ask him to stop. 100 penings might help.
Silence him permanently.
You are travelling through the forest and you suddenly spot a wild hare trapped in the snare. What do you do?
Free the animal.
Clench the snare and kill the animal!
Pass by the animal and ignore it.
You receive news that a group of veteran warriors has heard of your fame and wishes to join you. However, they ask more pay than you typically pay for such troops.
They are welcome.
I do not need more troops.
Kill them. Surely they will yield some good loot.
You receive news that a number of women express interest in becoming camp followers.
They are welcome.
I do not need more mouths to feed.
You receive news that a group of street musicians wishes to join you as army musicians and a standard bearer.
They are welcome.
I do not need more troops.
You see a crane circling above your party.
Tell to your men that the crane symbolizes victory!
Ignore it.
Tell them that the cranes warn of bad fortune, but you have faith in them!
A country farmer stands before you on the road with a weeping girl behind him. He points his finger accusingly at one of your men, saying that he raped his daughter and must be punished.
You will not tolerate indecency amongst your men! Brand the man and cast him out of your party.
It is a hard world, and a man must take what he can.
After hours, while your army rests near a village, the priest's wife comes to see you (alone) while her husband is away.
You agree.
You refuse.
Your fame and popularity have attracted young Norsemen to your cause.
Accept them.
I don't need more men.

You spot a poor man on the road. He looks tired. You send one of your men to ask him why he is in the wilderness alone. He says that men robbed him, and if he doesn't get some money soon, he will starve. He says he served in the army once, and will make a loyal warrior.
Life's not fair. Give him nothing.
Give him money only to eat a day (10 penings).
Give him money for several days (200 penings).
Pay him and suggest he join your army.

A group of bandits approaches your camp. As your men reach for their arms, the bandits put down their weapons and say they come in peace. The leader of the bandits approaches you and asks if they may join you.
Of course! My party always welcomes bloodthirsty men!
I'm sorry, we have no room for your kind!
Prove yourselves worthy by raiding a village and bringing me the chief's head!
Kill them all!
You come across the grave of an old forgotten warlord.
Rifle it for loot!
Leave the place.
Tend to the grave and pay your respects.
You come across unguarded cattle from a nearby village
Return the animals to the village and ask for no reward.
I will return the animals -- and demand a reward.
Dinner! Round up and slaughter the animals.
A small camp is established for troops you want to leave in this place for the moment.
Take a look at the troops.
FINAL
You are able to capture one of the enemy's ships. It's a {s2}. But due to the fight the '{s1}' is in a bad condition. Do you want to add this ship to your fleet?
Add the ship to your fleet.
Go to Sandbox mode?
You are starting a sea travel.
